body_content.explanation: a deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring), originally from China, whose leaves are used in traditional medicine and whose nuts and seeds are used in cooking :
examples: The maidenhair tree is one of the oldest living tree species.
Maidenhair trees were first brought here from China in the 18th century.
The Maidenhair Tree is unique, with no close living relatives.
